protocol_name: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables fusion protein delivery to Tp frustule
protocol_name_html: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables fusion protein delivery to Tp frustule
description: This revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana conjugation protocol builds on the following two protocols: Conjugation of Thalassiosira pseudonana (DOI: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.f55bq86) & Pour plating of Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) (DOI: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.jfncjme). Readers are strongly encouraged to read both before using this one. Gene-EGFP fusion depicted in the 'Expected Results' section was expressed under consitutive Tp-derived fcp promoter and terminator using pTpPuc3 episome backbone described in Karas et al. (2015).
protocol_affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)
affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Pick bacterial colonies from Gent20 (pTA-Mob) + Kan50 (pTpPuc3 episome) plates and inoculate 3 mL LB medium. You can use pre-made glycerol stocks instead. Shake overnight at 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick bacterial colonies from Gent20 (pTA-Mob) + Kan50 (pTpPuc3 episome) plates and inoculate 3 mL LB medium. You can use pre-made glycerol stocks instead. Shake overnight at 37 °C.

components.data: Passage 1:200 in 50 mL LB medium. Shake at 37 °C until OD600 reaches 0.3–0.4.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 5 of Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a silica-associated EGFP fusion protein to Tp frustule
source_data.protocol_name: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a protein to Tp frustule
source_data.protocol_name_html: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a protein to Tp frustule
source_data.annotation:
'Tp L1' was buffered with 10 mM Tris-HCl and pH was adjusted to 8. This allows longer maintenance of Tp in culture without crashing. It also induces sexual reproduction, possibly due to excess nitrate in 'Tp L1' and extra nitrogen from Tris. Auxospores can be readily observed in this buffered 'Tp L1'. Readers are referred to this study for further information.

 

'Tp L1' preparation details are available in this protocol.
source_data.thread_text:
'Tp L1' was buffered with 10 mM Tris-HCl and pH was adjusted to 8. This allows longer maintenance of Tp in culture without crashing. It also induces sexual reproduction, possibly due to excess nitrate in 'Tp L1' and extra nitrogen from Tris. Auxospores can be readily observed in this buffered 'Tp L1'. Readers are referred to this study for further information.

 

'Tp L1' preparation details are available in this protocol.
source_data.body:
'Tp L1' was buffered with 10 mM Tris-HCl and pH was adjusted to 8. This allows longer maintenance of Tp in culture without crashing. It also induces sexual reproduction, possibly due to excess nitrate in 'Tp L1' and extra nitrogen from Tris. Auxospores can be readily observed in this buffered 'Tp L1'. Readers are referred to this study for further information.

 

'Tp L1' preparation details are available in this protocol.

components.data: Centrifuge 2 x 108 cells 10 min / 4000 rpm / 10 °C. Add a few mL to your calculation due to cell death and losses during centrifugation (e.g. in this protocols 20 instead of calculated 15.4 mL were spun down).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 2 x 108 cells 10 min / 4000 rpm / 10 °C. Add a few mL to your calculation due to cell death and losses during centrifugation (e.g. in this protocols 20 instead of calculated 15.4 mL were spun down).

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 200 µL (~4 x 107 cells) Tp cell suspension to 1.5 mL epptube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 µL (~4 x 107 cells) Tp cell suspension to 1.5 mL epptube.

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 200 µL E. coli cell suspension. Pipette up and down a few (~5) times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 µL E. coli cell suspension. Pipette up and down a few (~5) times.

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Plate the mix (i.e. all 400 µL) on 1/2 'Tp L1' 5% LB 1% agar plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plate the mix (i.e. all 400 µL) on 1/2 'Tp L1' 5% LB 1% agar plate.

source_data.annotation: Plates have to be pre-dried. Leave them half lid open in the hood for 90 min before plating.

source_data.body: Plates have to be pre-dried. Leave them half lid open in the hood for 90 min before plating.

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate plates 90 min at 30 °C in dark (i.e. where you normally grow yeast).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate plates 90 min at 30 °C in dark (i.e. where you normally grow yeast).

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate plates additional 4 hrs at 18 °C under constant light (i.e. where you normally grow Tp).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate plates additional 4 hrs at 18 °C under constant light (i.e. where you normally grow Tp).

components.data: Conjugation
components.name: Section

components.data: Scrape co-culture with 1 mL 'Tp L1' and transfer to 1.5 mL epptube. Use L spreader. Expect ~600–700 µL material.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Scrape co-culture with 1 mL 'Tp L1' and transfer to 1.5 mL epptube. Use L spreader. Expect ~600–700 µL material.

components.data: Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: Plate 50 and 500 µL using the pour plating method (crucial). Use 100 µg/mL nourseothricin sulfate for selection in pour plates.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plate 50 and 500 µL using the pour plating method (crucial). Use 100 µg/mL nourseothricin sulfate for selection in pour plates.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 13 of Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a silica-associated EGFP fusion protein to Tp frustule
source_data.protocol_name: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a protein to Tp frustule
source_data.protocol_name_html: Revisited Thalassiosira pseudonana (Tp) conjugation protocol enables delivery of a protein to Tp frustule
source_data.annotation:
1. Regular non-superclean agar may work, but this hasn't been tested (yet).

 

2. Some WT Tp colonies were observed in/on control plates which could be due to antibiotic depletion (2 x 10^7 cells were plated). Control plates contained 100 µg/mL nourseothricin sulfate.
source_data.thread_text:
1. Regular non-superclean agar may work, but this hasn't been tested (yet).

 

2. Some WT Tp colonies were observed in/on control plates which could be due to antibiotic depletion (2 x 10^7 cells were plated). Control plates contained 100 µg/mL nourseothricin sulfate.
source_data.body:
1. Regular non-superclean agar may work, but this hasn't been tested (yet).

 

2. Some WT Tp colonies were observed in/on control plates which could be due to antibiotic depletion (2 x 10^7 cells were plated). Control plates contained 100 µg/mL nourseothricin sulfate.

components.data: Brief summary of results
components.name: Section

components.data: Dozens of colonies emerged in pour plates after ~2 weeks and 300 µL 'minicultures' were started from single colonies (200 µg/mL, not 100, nourseothricin sulfate to additionally increase selection pressure). Gene-specific primers were used for genetoyping and Leica TCS SP5 for EGFP signal screening. Scale bars below: 25 µm (top row), 5 µm. Expected cell wall localiztion pattern was observed in select lines.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dozens of colonies emerged in pour plates after ~2 weeks and 300 µL 'minicultures' were started from single colonies (200 µg/mL, not 100, nourseothricin sulfate to additionally increase selection pressure). Gene-specific primers were used for genetoyping and Leica TCS SP5 for EGFP signal screening. Scale bars below: 25 µm (top row), 5 µm. Expected cell wall localiztion pattern was observed in select lines.
